article: 12 Ways to Fix It When an iPhone Camera Is Not Working
intro: Is your iPhone camera app showing a black screen or not taking photos? This is most likely due to software glitches or certain settings on your device. Luckily, there are tons of easy fixes. Here's what to do if your iPhone camera is not working.

steps.title: Make sure your apps have camera access.
steps.subtitle: This permission can be controlled in your settings. Do the following:
sub-points: Make sure the app you're using is toggled on.

steps.title: Make sure your apps have camera access.
steps.subtitle: This permission can be controlled in your settings. Do the following:
sub-points: Make sure the app you're using is toggled on.

sub-points: Make sure the app you're using is toggled on.

steps.title: Switch to  mode, and then switch back.
steps.subtitle: Changing the camera mode from back-facing to front-facing to back-facing again may get it to work again.
sub-points: To change the camera, tap the overlapping circle icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen. On older iOS versions, this icon may be in the top-right corner instead.

steps.title: Restart your device.
steps.subtitle: A quick restart can fix common issues. Do the following:
sub-points: On iPhones without a Home button, press and hold the Power and Volume Up buttons until the Power slider appears.On iPhones with a Home button, press and hold the side button until the slider appears.
Slide the slider with your finger and wait for your iPhone to turn off.
Wait 30 seconds, and then turn it back on.

steps.title: Restart your device.

Slide the slider with your finger and wait for your iPhone to turn off.
Wait 30 seconds, and then turn it back on.

Wait 30 seconds, and then turn it back on.
